elements.subject: Send regular email summaries (email digest)

description.raw:
**As** an OpenProject user  
**I want** to receive have an regular email digest (hourly, daily, weekly) with all relevant updates in that timeframe  
**so that** I don't get spammed with email updates.

**Acceptance criteria:**

*   Be able to activate email digest for your own user account.
*   Choose time interval when to receive email digest (e.g. hourly, daily, weekly)
*   Filter for the information that are relevant to me.
    *   Projects
    *   Status transitions (e. g. in test -> test failed)
    *   Users (e.g. my client, my boss, my tester)

\===

Feature request by Samuel Andert (originally reported in #7226):

"As a User I want to have the option of hourly or daily "email updates"

When there is a lot of activity going on, it would be great, if it is possible to gather emails hourly or daily, or even a custom time slider, to not spam your email account.
description.html:
As an OpenProject user
I want to receive have an regular email digest (hourly, daily, weekly) with all relevant updates in that timeframe
so that I don't get spammed with email updates.

Acceptance criteria:

  • Be able to activate email digest for your own user account.
  • Choose time interval when to receive email digest (e.g. hourly, daily, weekly)
  • Filter for the information that are relevant to me.
    • Projects
    • Status transitions (e. g. in test -> test failed)
    • Users (e.g. my client, my boss, my tester)

===

Feature request by Samuel Andert (originally reported in #7226):

"As a User I want to have the option of hourly or daily "email updates"

When there is a lot of activity going on, it would be great, if it is possible to gather emails hourly or daily, or even a custom time slider, to not spam your email account.

self.title: Send regular email summaries (email digest)

availableRelationCandidates.title: Potential work packages to relate to

elements.subject: Delete project via project settings by non admins

description.raw:
**As** a project admin  
**I want** to delete my project myself  
**so that** I don’t need to ask the admin to do that.

**Acceptance criteria**

  - Delete link in project settings
  - Deletion only possible for users having the “delete\_project” permission
  - In case subprojects are present:
      - If the user has the “delete\_project” permission in all of the subprojects, the user is notified (a statement listing all the projects that are going to be deleted) and asked again whether he wants to delete all the projects
      - In case the user lacks the “delete\_project” permission in any of the subprojects, the user is notified that a deletion is currently impossible as he is lacking permissions in one of the subprojects 
  - “manager” role in default data receives “delete\_project” permission by default

**Wireframes**

  - See attachments
description.html:
As a project admin
I want to delete my project myself
so that I don’t need to ask the admin to do that.

Acceptance criteria

  • Delete link in project settings
  • Deletion only possible for users having the “delete_project” permission
  • In case subprojects are present:
    • If the user has the “delete_project” permission in all of the subprojects, the user is notified (a statement listing all the projects that are going to be deleted) and asked again whether he wants to delete all the projects
    • In case the user lacks the “delete_project” permission in any of the subprojects, the user is notified that a deletion is currently impossible as he is lacking permissions in one of the subprojects
  • “manager” role in default data receives “delete_project” permission by default

Wireframes

  • See attachments

self.title: Delete project via project settings by non admins

elements.subject: Archive project via project settings by non admins

description.raw:
**As** a project admin

**I want** to archive my project myself

**so that** I don’t need to ask the admin to do that.

**Acceptance criteria**

*   Archive link in project settings
*   Archive only possible for users having the “archive\_project” permission
*   Add "archive project" permission as global role
*   Alternatively set as project permission:
    *   In case subprojects are present:
        *   If the user has the “archive\_project” permission in all of the subprojects, the user is notified (a statement listing all the projects that are going to be archived) and asked again whether he wants to archive all the projects
        *   In case the user lacks the “archive\_project” permission in any of the subprojects, the user is notified that archiving is currently impossible as he is lacking permissions in one of the subprojects.
    *   “manager” role in default data receives “archive\_project” permission by default

**Out of scope**

*   Ability to unarchive a project for a non admin.

**Wireframes**

*   See attachments
description.html:
As a project admin

I want to archive my project myself

so that I don’t need to ask the admin to do that.

Acceptance criteria

  • Archive link in project settings
  • Archive only possible for users having the “archive_project” permission
  • Add "archive project" permission as global role
  • Alternatively set as project permission:
    • In case subprojects are present:
      • If the user has the “archive_project” permission in all of the subprojects, the user is notified (a statement listing all the projects that are going to be archived) and asked again whether he wants to archive all the projects
      • In case the user lacks the “archive_project” permission in any of the subprojects, the user is notified that archiving is currently impossible as he is lacking permissions in one of the subprojects.
    • “manager” role in default data receives “archive_project” permission by default

Out of scope

  • Ability to unarchive a project for a non admin.

Wireframes

  • See attachments

self.title: Archive project via project settings by non admins

elements.subject: Show meetings in calendar

description.raw:
**As** an OpenProject user  
**I want** to show created meetings also in the calendar  
**so that** I can include an overview of all meeting activities.

**Acceptance criteria (to be discussed):**

*   Meetings should be displayed by default (only displayed if the module is activated in a project)
*   Not possible to filter out meetings
*   Filters only affect work packages, not meetings

**Visuals:**

I want to show created meetings also in the calendar
so that I can include an overview of all meeting activities.

Acceptance criteria (to be discussed):

  • Not possible to filter out meetings

elements.subject: Dynamic Related Work Packages

description.raw:
I’d like to see work package relations be able to be defined with a query so that they are automatically updated as new tasks are added or updated to fit the criteria of the query. I’ve started tracking event type tasks and those events require keeping up with multiples of different types of tasks that meet the same criteria. Right now I have to daily go in and query to find tasks meeting that criteria and manually adding them to the task as a related work package.

Having the query defined with the WP to dynamically populate the related work package list would be most excellent.
description.html:
I’d like to see work package relations be able to be defined with a query so that they are automatically updated as new tasks are added or updated to fit the criteria of the query. I’ve started tracking event type tasks and those events require keeping up with multiples of different types of tasks that meet the same criteria. Right now I have to daily go in and query to find tasks meeting that criteria and manually adding them to the task as a related work package.

Having the query defined with the WP to dynamically populate the related work package list would be most excellent.

self.title: Dynamic Related Work Packages

elements.subject: Bidirectional Forum - WP association

description.raw: I’d like to see a way to link a Forum discussion to a work package such that when viewing the forum you can quickly see the status of the work package (perhaps tagged in the subject line with a link to the WP). In addition I’d like to have the forum discussion embedded in the work package such that when I’m viewing a work package with a related forum discussion I can easily expand the discussion to view and reply in line if needed.

elements.subject: Filter between two numeric values

description.raw:
When specifying the work package query filters, we need the ability to either add the same field twice, once for \<= and once for \>= or have another filter option that allows you to specify something between two values.

For example, if a Custom Field of type float has values 1.4, 2.0, 2.5, 2.7, 3.0 you should be able to apply a filter that only shows 2.0, 2.5 and 2.7.
description.html:
When specifying the work package query filters, we need the ability to either add the same field twice, once for <= and once for >= or have another filter option that allows you to specify something between two values.

For example, if a Custom Field of type float has values 1.4, 2.0, 2.5, 2.7, 3.0 you should be able to apply a filter that only shows 2.0, 2.5 and 2.7.

self.title: Filter between two numeric values

elements.subject: Move Work Package should allow setting of Custom Fields

description.raw:
When moving a work package to another project and type, custom fields for the selected destination should be shown and be able to be completed by the user.

Currently if there are any required custom fields in the destination project and type, the work package cannot be moved and an error message is returned.
description.html:
When moving a work package to another project and type, custom fields for the selected destination should be shown and be able to be completed by the user.

Currently if there are any required custom fields in the destination project and type, the work package cannot be moved and an error message is returned.

self.title: Move Work Package should allow setting of Custom Fields

elements.subject: Moving Forum Messages Across Project Boundaries

description.raw: We’re getting a large number of forum messages posted to the wrong project and would like to move them to the correct location. There is already the capability to move to another forum within the same project but it appears that you can’t move it to a forum in another project. The move function should allow for moving to any forum on any project which the user has rights to see.

elements.subject: Email reminder / notification when due date of work package or custom field of type date is approaching

description.raw: **As** an OpenProject user **I want** to receive an email notification when the due date of a work package (or a custom field of type date) is approaching (or is overdue) **so that** I do not forget important deadlines. **Use case (example)** * A ticket of type bill or invoice has been created and needs to be paid. The user can easily forget to pay the bill if not reminded. **Acceptance criteria** * Timeframe for reminder should be configurable. * Reminders should be sent for both end dates of work packages and custom fields of type date. * For custom fields of type date it has to be possible to define whether a reminder should be sent (if a relevant end date is referenced) or not (e.g. when a start date is referenced). To be discussed * should this be available for start dates, too? * ~~can the Redmine function be used? (see respective comment)~~ (It will not match the desired functionality, e.g. it cannot be modified from the UI and it will be user independent) **Visuals (very preliminary):**
description.html:
As an OpenProject user
I want to receive an email notification when the due date of a work package (or a custom field of type date) is approaching (or is overdue)
so that I do not forget important deadlines.

Use case (example)

  • A ticket of type bill or invoice has been created and needs to be paid. The user can easily forget to pay the bill if not reminded.

Acceptance criteria

  • Timeframe for reminder should be configurable.
  • Reminders should be sent for both end dates of work packages and custom fields of type date.
  • For custom fields of type date it has to be possible to define whether a reminder should be sent (if a relevant end date is referenced) or not (e.g. when a start date is referenced).

To be discussed

  • should this be available for start dates, too?
  • can the Redmine function be used? (see respective comment) (It will not match the desired functionality, e.g. it cannot be modified from the UI and it will be user independent)

Visuals (very preliminary):

self.title: Email reminder / notification when due date of work package or custom field of type date is approaching

availableRelationCandidates.title: Potential work packages to relate to

elements.subject: Add calendar export feed (iCalendar)

description.raw:
While trying to introduce OpenProject in a team that I’m part of, I realised that there is no way to integrate the calendar with MS Outlook, Apple Calendar, Google Calendar, and the likes. It would greatly increase the visibility of project planning if people were able to see changes in their preferred calendar apps, instead of having to check the OpenProject calendar webpage. Export funcitonality would provide a very natural means to integrate OpenProject with existing planning and coordination routines established in teams (most of which will be using a calendar app of sorts).

  

\-- Copied from duplicate --

Actually Calendars in OpenProject are project based (an overall view over all projects or the projects an user has access to) is not provided. Further users may have other calendars (business and/or private) they want to have a merged view on their (mobile) devices. Therefore exporting publishing OpenProject Calendar data by the well supported CalDAV protocol would be very appreciated. Hereby an user can:

*   select (filter) in here user preferences which aspects (project status, type of tasks/meetings, date range) of the calendar she wants to be subscribed to
*   CalDAV access may be read only
description.html:
While trying to introduce OpenProject in a team that I’m part of, I realised that there is no way to integrate the calendar with MS Outlook, Apple Calendar, Google Calendar, and the likes. It would greatly increase the visibility of project planning if people were able to see changes in their preferred calendar apps, instead of having to check the OpenProject calendar webpage. Export funcitonality would provide a very natural means to integrate OpenProject with existing planning and coordination routines established in teams (most of which will be using a calendar app of sorts).

-- Copied from duplicate --

Actually Calendars in OpenProject are project based (an overall view over all projects or the projects an user has access to) is not provided. Further users may have other calendars (business and/or private) they want to have a merged view on their (mobile) devices. Therefore exporting publishing OpenProject Calendar data by the well supported CalDAV protocol would be very appreciated. Hereby an user can:

  • select (filter) in here user preferences which aspects (project status, type of tasks/meetings, date range) of the calendar she wants to be subscribed to
  • CalDAV access may be read only

self.title: Add calendar export feed (iCalendar)

elements.subject: Work packages with reduced visibility

description.raw:
**As** an OpenProject user  
**I want** to be able to limit the visibility of work packages to users and groups which I specify  
**so that** I can have private work packages.

**Acceptance criteria**

*   Restrict WorkPackage visibility by role, independend of project (see Redmine screenshot for Roles configuration)
*   Private tickets cannot be seen / edited by users who are not allowed to see them:
    *   Not shown in work package list
    *   Links to those work packages (e.g. via Wiki syntax) are not functional
    *   Related work packages, parent & child work packages which are private are not shown
description.html:
As an OpenProject user
I want to be able to limit the visibility of work packages to users and groups which I specify
so that I can have private work packages.

Acceptance criteria

  • Restrict WorkPackage visibility by role, independend of project (see Redmine screenshot for Roles configuration)
  • Private tickets cannot be seen / edited by users who are not allowed to see them:
    • Not shown in work package list
    • Links to those work packages (e.g. via Wiki syntax) are not functional
    • Related work packages, parent & child work packages which are private are not shown

self.title: Work packages with reduced visibility

elements.subject: Add missing actions to context menu in work packages list

description.raw:
**As** an OpenProject user  
**I want** to update work packages in the list using the context menu:  
**so that** I can quickly adapt those values.

**Acceptance criteria**

  - Bulk edit of all selected work packages
  - Attributes that can be changed
      - Status 
      - Type
      - Priority
      - Version
      - Assignee
      - Responsible
      - % done
      - Single select custom fields
  - If listed in context menu the % done steps are shown in increments of 10% (0, 10, 20, … 100)
  - Only valid attributes can be selected.

**Example**  
![](Work-Package_Context-Menu.PNG)

**Out of scope**

  - Changing types
  - The user can not decide <ins>not</ins> to send an email notifications.

elements.subject: Query selection for cost reports

description.raw:
**As** an OpenProject user  
**I want** the query selection to be the same as in the work package page  
**so that** only the current / important queries are displayed in the side menu.

**Acceptance criteria**

  - Implement query select (ui-select) in the cost report headline.
  - Add the option to add queries to the side menu.
  - Add a page configuration for making cost reports public / private.

**Business use case**

  - Having many cost reports (e.g. monthly and yearly reports for WDR, Yopeso reports for 3 teams for each sprints, …) it’s difficult to keep track of the currently relevant reports.
  - For documentation purposes, I don’t want to delete old reports but don’t want to display them in the side menu either.

**Screenshot**  
![](Cost-Reports.png)

I want the query selection to be the same as in the work package page
so that only the current / important queries are displayed in the side menu.

elements.subject: Integrate project attributes in work packages filter

description.raw:
**As an** OpenProject developer  
**I want to** filter my work packages on project attributes  
**so that** I can delete the timelines legacy code.

**Acceptance criteria**

  - Multi select filter on *project type*.
  - Multi select filter on subprojects of.
  - Multi select filter on project status.
  - Multi select filter on *project custom fields*.
      - User
      - List
  - Project should be displayed even if they do not contain any work packages.
  - Results displayed in existing work packages table.

<!-- end list -->

  - Examples
      - Filter all projects that are subprojects of project “IPTV Sytems” that have a work package of type “rollout” in Q3 2015.
      - Filter all project of type “EA” in project status “red”.
description.html:
As an OpenProject developer
I want to filter my work packages on project attributes
so that I can delete the timelines legacy code.

Acceptance criteria

  • Multi select filter on project type.
  • Multi select filter on subprojects of.
  • Multi select filter on project status.
  • Multi select filter on project custom fields.
    • User
    • List
  • Project should be displayed even if they do not contain any work packages.
  • Results displayed in existing work packages table.
  • Examples
    • Filter all projects that are subprojects of project “IPTV Sytems” that have a work package of type “rollout” in Q3 2015.
    • Filter all project of type “EA” in project status “red”.

self.title: Integrate project attributes in work packages filter

availableRelationCandidates.title: Potential work packages to relate to

elements.subject: Allow working days (holiday & weekends) definition

description.raw: # Problem * It is currently hard to create project schedules as when work packages span a weekend. In these cases the weekend days are counted as normal working days. * When projects change the start day of a work package the calculation of the finish date does not take into account any non-working days between the start and the finish date. > **Example:** A task starts on Monday and finishs on Friday. If the task is delayed by one day the finish date is set for the Saturday. Since Saturday is a non-working day in this scenario the more accurate calculation for the finish date would be Monday. # Solution * For each each installation an Admin can set a default working-day calendar which is preset for all projects. * The calculation of the finish date takes the availability calendar into account (see example in the problem statement). ## Visuals # **Out of Scope for the MVC** * Adding public holidays to the seed data. * Selecting non-working days on a project level. * Non-working-days of individual team members. * Subscribe to external calendars, e.g. Google calendars. * Duration calculation based on people assignments and work (effort) estimate (fixed work mode).
description.html:
Problem

  • It is currently hard to create project schedules as when work packages span a weekend. In these cases the weekend days are counted as normal working days.
  • When projects change the start day of a work package the calculation of the finish date does not take into account any non-working days between the start and the finish date.

Example: A task starts on Monday and finishs on Friday. If the task is delayed by one day the finish date is set for the Saturday. Since Saturday is a non-working day in this scenario the more accurate calculation for the finish date would be Monday.

Solution

  • For each each installation an Admin can set a default working-day calendar which is preset for all projects.
  • The calculation of the finish date takes the availability calendar into account (see example in the problem statement).

Visuals

Out of Scope for the MVC

  • Adding public holidays to the seed data.
  • Selecting non-working days on a project level.
  • Non-working-days of individual team members.
  • Subscribe to external calendars, e.g. Google calendars.
  • Duration calculation based on people assignments and work (effort) estimate (fixed work mode).

self.title: Allow working days (holiday & weekends) definition

**Acceptance criteria**

**I want** to be able to assign a single global Budget to the main Project, not just Work Packages.  
**so that** I can link the same budget to the Project’s Subprojects for accurate total cost and balance sheet for that one Budget.

I want to be able to assign a single global Budget to the main Project, not just Work Packages.
so that I can link the same budget to the Project’s Subprojects for accurate total cost and balance sheet for that one Budget.

elements.subject: CRUD operations for groups in API v3

description.raw:
**As an** OpenProject user  
**I want to** create, read, update and delete groups through the API v3  
**so that** I can integrate OpenProject with other systems.

**Acceptance criteria**

*   Create group
*   Delete group
*   Edit group
    *   Change name
*   Add or remove user to a group
*   Adding a user to a group creates project memberships.
*   Removing a user from a group removes project memberships.
*   List groups of a user
*   List users of a group
*   ~~List all groups of a project~~ Members, regardless of whether they are a group or a native user can already be fetched via the API.
*   ~~Adding and remove groups from projects~~ Already implemented

**To be discussed**

*   ~~Should a group have an email address, e.g. for notifications~~ (out of scope)
description.html:
As an OpenProject user
I want to create, read, update and delete groups through the API v3
so that I can integrate OpenProject with other systems.

Acceptance criteria

  • Create group
  • Delete group
  • Edit group
    • Change name
  • Add or remove user to a group
  • Adding a user to a group creates project memberships.
  • Removing a user from a group removes project memberships.
  • List groups of a user
  • List users of a group
  • List all groups of a project Members, regardless of whether they are a group or a native user can already be fetched via the API.
  • Adding and remove groups from projects Already implemented

To be discussed

  • Should a group have an email address, e.g. for notifications (out of scope)

self.title: CRUD operations for groups in API v3

children.title: Allow adding users to Group via API v3

elements.subject: Custom field format for eMail, URLs and Long Rich Text

description.raw:
<ins>**Description**</ins>

<ins>**As**</ins> an OpenProject user  
<ins>**I want**</ins> to be able to add custom fields for eMail, URL and Wiki styled long texts  
<ins>**so that**</ins> directly eMail, link to Websites or have a customized entry in the corresponding format

<ins>**Further descryption**</ins>  
This is a feature introduced to Redmine and Chiliproject and is missed in OpenProject.  
It would be very handy to use for additional user details or project description.  
Maybe it could also be implemented as plugin like the “Extended Fields Plugin”: http://www.redmine.org/plugins/extended\_fields

It would be very handy to use for additional user details or project description.
Maybe it could also be implemented as plugin like the “Extended Fields Plugin”: http://www.redmine.org/plugins/extended_fields

elements.subject: Reauthentication ("danger zone") on critical operations

description.raw:
**As an** OpenProjectc.com user  
**I want to** be forced to reauthenticate  
**so that** someone taking over my session can not make those changes and I think twice before making those changes.

**Acceptance criteria**

  - There is a “danger zone” (like in GitHub) for critical commands where the user has to provide his password again such as:
      - Changing email address
      - Changing password
      - Deleting organization
      - Deleting repository
      - \[…\]

**Note**  
This is split off from \#16546

    • Changing email address
    • Changing password
    • Deleting organization
    • Deleting repository
    • […]

Note
This is split off from #16546

self.title: Reauthentication ("danger zone") on critical operations

elements.subject: Add maximum number of events in activity page

description.raw:
**Current situation**

  - Loading of the page gets very slow if a lot of things happened the last couple of days.

**Expected behavior**

  - There should be a pagination that limits the maximum number of activity items shown on one page.
  - Place menu item “Activities” inside the “Modules” menu (split off of \#20512)
  - Uses aggregated journals (\#\#20690)

**Open**

  - What is a good number of maximum items for one page?

**Out of scope**

  - Styling
  - Configuration

availableRelationCandidates.title: Potential work packages to relate to

elements.subject: [API] Specify expectance of Payload

description.raw:
**As** a developer  
**I want** to know when an API endpoint expects a payload  
**so that** I can make sure to properly get the most out of the API

**Acceptance criteria**

  - Link objects specify whether they expect a payload to be transmitted
      - This doesn’t have to be realised via the existing payload attribute
      - A separate (boolean) attribute can be sufficient.
  - Link objects which use the HTTP verbs GET or DELETE cannot receive a payload and therefore don’t necessarily need to specify that they do not expect one.
      - This should be explained at a rather prominent position within the API documentation.
description.html:
As a developer
I want to know when an API endpoint expects a payload
so that I can make sure to properly get the most out of the API

Acceptance criteria

  • Link objects specify whether they expect a payload to be transmitted
    • This doesn’t have to be realised via the existing payload attribute
    • A separate (boolean) attribute can be sufficient.
  • Link objects which use the HTTP verbs GET or DELETE cannot receive a payload and therefore don’t necessarily need to specify that they do not expect one.
    • This should be explained at a rather prominent position within the API documentation.

self.title: [API] Specify expectance of Payload

elements.subject: OpenProject::Configuration API

description.raw:
Currently, every plugins wanting to add a configuration setting has to patch OpenProject::Configuration itself leading to high code complexity and the need for changes at multiple places if OpenProject::Configuration ever changes.

One example for this is in the [reporting engine](https://github.com/finnlabs/openproject-reporting/pull/69/files#diff-3a6b42471443f0cca8c239e25b8ecc84R43). This example might also serve as a template for the implementation.

**Acceptance criteria**

  - The core provides an API which the plugins can use to add a configuration setting.
description.html:
Currently, every plugins wanting to add a configuration setting has to patch OpenProject::Configuration itself leading to high code complexity and the need for changes at multiple places if OpenProject::Configuration ever changes.

One example for this is in the reporting engine. This example might also serve as a template for the implementation.

Acceptance criteria

  • The core provides an API which the plugins can use to add a configuration setting.

self.title: OpenProject::Configuration API

availableRelationCandidates.title: Potential work packages to relate to

elements.subject: Move tab "Versions" from project settings to the project module

description.raw:
**Current situation**

*   The versions tab provides the following features:
    *   Create versions
    *   Delete versions
    *   Close completed versions
*   There is no overview of the versions accessible from the project module.

**Objectives**

*   Improve usability for users new to OpenProject
*   Reduce maintenance effort for code maintenance by removing duplicate views.

**Acceptance criteria**

*   Move versions table to project module.
*   Add toolbar to versions list with the button “Create”.
*   Add delete button to versions details view.
*   Remove feature “Close completed versions”.
description.html:
Current situation

  • The versions tab provides the following features:
    • Create versions
    • Delete versions
    • Close completed versions
  • There is no overview of the versions accessible from the project module.

Objectives

  • Improve usability for users new to OpenProject
  • Reduce maintenance effort for code maintenance by removing duplicate views.

Acceptance criteria

  • Move versions table to project module.
  • Add toolbar to versions list with the button “Create”.
  • Add delete button to versions details view.
  • Remove feature “Close completed versions”.

self.title: Move tab "Versions" from project settings to the project module

elements.subject: Save calendar queries

description.raw:
**As** an Open Project User  
**I want** to have the possibility to save Calendar queries  
**So that** the calendar feature would be usable in a much faster way

It would be great to have the possibility to save Calendar filter configuration because as now the calendar function is not very usefull as it take time to configure the filter each time we need different queries.  
It could be great it we can save the queries in the same manner as with Work Packages views.  
As now nobody in our company use the calendar feature as it is too time consuming but it would be helpful to use the feature in order to have a better view of the work packages.

So that the calendar feature would be usable in a much faster way

It would be great to have the possibility to save Calendar filter configuration because as now the calendar function is not very usefull as it take time to configure the filter each time we need different queries.
It could be great it we can save the queries in the same manner as with Work Packages views.
As now nobody in our company use the calendar feature as it is too time consuming but it would be helpful to use the feature in order to have a better view of the work packages.

elements.subject: [Repository Settings] Expand keywords possibility

description.raw:
**As an** Administrator  
**I want to** define more than referencing and fixing keywords.  
**So that i** can define another keyword with another applied status  
e.g

  - keyword: closes -\> AppliedStatus: closed -\> 100% done
  - keyword: to test -\> AppliedStatus: to test -\> 50% done
  - keyword: in work -\> Applied Status: in work -\> % (no change)
  - keyword: 50%done -\> Applied Staus: (no change) -\> 50% done  
    …

This could be realized with a “+” Button, to add a new keyword for a new status.
description.html:
As an Administrator
I want to define more than referencing and fixing keywords.
So that i can define another keyword with another applied status
e.g

  • keyword: closes -> AppliedStatus: closed -> 100% done
  • keyword: to test -> AppliedStatus: to test -> 50% done
  • keyword: in work -> Applied Status: in work -> % (no change)
  • keyword: 50%done -> Applied Staus: (no change) -> 50% done
    …

This could be realized with a “+” Button, to add a new keyword for a new status.

self.title: [Repository Settings] Expand keywords possibility

elements.subject: Custom fields of type version should include shared versions

description.raw:
**As** an OpenProject user  
**I want** custom fields of type “version” to include versions shared by other projects  
**so that** they can be used in place of versions.

**Acceptance criteria**

  - A custom field of type version includes not only the version of the project itself but also versions which have been shared with the project.
  - The available values for custom fields of type version are the same as for “normal” versions.

  • The available values for custom fields of type version are the same as for “normal” versions.

elements.subject: Category field (read-only) displayed in split screen/fullscreen when no category exists

description.raw:
**Preconditions**

  - Work package module activated.
  - No category exists in a project.

**Steps to reproduce**

1.  Open an existing work package in the project (full screen / split screen).
2.  Take a look at the field “Category” and try to edit it.

**Actual behavior**

  - Field category is displayed but cannot be edited.
      - It is unclear to the user why the attribute cannot be edited.

**Expected behavior**

  - Either do not display the category field unless at least one category exists in the project or notify the user why the field cannot be edited (i.e. at least one category needs to exist in the project in order to assign a value).

**Screenshot**  
![](Bug_Category.png)

**QA system**

  - org-dev.qa.finn.de
  - OpenProject 5.0.0
description.html:
Preconditions

  • Work package module activated.
  • No category exists in a project.

Steps to reproduce

  1. Open an existing work package in the project (full screen / split screen).
  2. Take a look at the field “Category” and try to edit it.

Actual behavior

  • Field category is displayed but cannot be edited.
    • It is unclear to the user why the attribute cannot be edited.

Expected behavior

  • Either do not display the category field unless at least one category exists in the project or notify the user why the field cannot be edited (i.e. at least one category needs to exist in the project in order to assign a value).

Screenshot

QA system

  • org-dev.qa.finn.de
  • OpenProject 5.0.0

self.title: Category field (read-only) displayed in split screen/fullscreen when no category exists

elements.subject: Show logged time (Spent time) in hours and days

description.raw:
**As an** OpenProject user  
**I want to** be able to switch to days  
**so that** I get an better overview of the logged time for large numbers.

**Acceptance criteria**

  - There is a switch between days and hours.
      - Hours
      - Days
  - Roundings to two digits
  - There is a setting how many hours a day has (default 8 hours).
  - Default unit remains hours

As an OpenProject user
I want to be able to switch to days
so that I get an better overview of the logged time for large numbers.

Acceptance criteria

  • There is a switch between days and hours.
    • Hours
    • Days
  • Roundings to two digits
  • There is a setting how many hours a day has (default 8 hours).
  • Default unit remains hours

elements.subject: Log time for other users

description.raw:
**As an** OpenProject user  
**I want to** log time for other users  
**so that** I can take over the task if the user does not have access to the system.

**Acceptance criteria**

*   There is a separate permission to log time for another user “Log time for other users”.
*   The current permission is renamed to “Log own time.”
*   There is a separate select field “User” showing all project members.
*   There is journal entry showing who made the entry.
description.html:
As an OpenProject user
I want to log time for other users
so that I can take over the task if the user does not have access to the system.

Acceptance criteria

  • There is a separate permission to log time for another user “Log time for other users”.
  • The current permission is renamed to “Log own time.”
  • There is a separate select field “User” showing all project members.
  • There is journal entry showing who made the entry.

self.title: Log time for other users

availableRelationCandidates.title: Potential work packages to relate to

elements.subject: Changes don't lost when switching between tabs in the work packages split view

description.raw:
**As an** OpenProject user  
**I want to** switch the tabs without loosing content  
**so that** there is less risk to lose my work.

**Current behavior**

1.  Change a value in the overview tab without saving.
2.  Moving to another tab (e.g. watchers or relations).
3.  Moving back to the overview tab.
4.  **Result**: My changes are lost

**Expected behavior**

  - The changed field is still in the edit mode.
  - The changes don’t get lost.
description.html:
As an OpenProject user
I want to switch the tabs without loosing content
so that there is less risk to lose my work.

Current behavior

  1. Change a value in the overview tab without saving.
  2. Moving to another tab (e.g. watchers or relations).
  3. Moving back to the overview tab.
  4. Result: My changes are lost

Expected behavior

  • The changed field is still in the edit mode.
  • The changes don’t get lost.

self.title: Changes don't lost when switching between tabs in the work packages split view

description.html: Currently we have a cron job running dealing with incoming emails. We should make this happen in real time because it’s somehow confusing in the use-case where you just answered to a work package but then go there and you can’t see your comment.

**so that** I can more easily create new projects based on a template.

> Expected behavior: All work packages are copied without a budget.

so that I can more easily create new projects based on a template.

Expected behavior: All work packages are copied without a budget.

self.title: Copy project budget when copying a project

elements.subject: Avoid confirmation dialog in WP edit when no content was added

description.raw:
The following line sets wiki-textareas to dirty/changed immediately after their creation, resulting in the ‘confirm unsaved changes’ dialog in the force edit mode, even when no data has been entered.

Additionally, the dialog is not shown when the cancel button is shown. This is somewhat inconsistent and I suggest that we correct both these behaviors.

More information:  
Relevant line that sets the textarea to changed: https://github.com/opf/openproject/blob/dev/frontend/app/components/inplace-edit/directives/field-edit/edit-wiki-textarea/edit-wiki-textarea.directive.js\#L48
description.html:
The following line sets wiki-textareas to dirty/changed immediately after their creation, resulting in the ‘confirm unsaved changes’ dialog in the force edit mode, even when no data has been entered.

Additionally, the dialog is not shown when the cancel button is shown. This is somewhat inconsistent and I suggest that we correct both these behaviors.

More information:
Relevant line that sets the textarea to changed: https://github.com/opf/openproject/blob/dev/frontend/app/components/inplace-edit/directives/field-edit/edit-wiki-textarea/edit-wiki-textarea.directive.js#L48

self.title: Avoid confirmation dialog in WP edit when no content was added

description.raw:
The state of work package autocompletion is unclear when the latency until the server responds is non-negligible.

The autocompletion should feature a loading indicator to communicate the current state.
